item.title: Jennie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "How awful it was, thought Tessa, remembering Fats the toddler, the way tiny ghosts of your living children haunted your heart; they could never know, and would hate it if they did, how their growing was a constant bereavement." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Linda Grant
item.description: "I threw one box in the recycling bin. I'm going to hell, a hell in which eternity is a Kindle with a dead battery." -- Linda Grant

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "Music [is] the third rail of life. You grabbed it to shock yourself out of the dull drag of hours. To feel something. To burn with all the emotions you didn't get to experience in the ordinary run of school, TV, and loading the dishwasher after dinner." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Hans Ulrich Gumbrecht
item.description: "We know—more from the faces immortalized on a handful of photographs than from the words of survivors—that the women and men who experienced that moment in Hiroshima believed they had encountered the beginning of the end of the world. There will never be enough future to prove them wrong." -- Hans Ulrich Gumbrecht

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "You think you know someone. But mostly you just know what you want to know." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "Taking a thing apart is always faster than putting something together. This is true of everything except marriage." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Jennie add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "He'd possessed all the key elements of a school shooter: hormones, misery, ammunition. People wondered how something like Columbine could happen. Jude wondered why it didn't happen more often." -- Joe Hill
